org.gbif.crawler

Class Crawler<CTX extends CrawlContext,REQ,RESP,RES>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.crawler.Crawler<CTX,REQ,RESP,RES>
  • Type Parameters:
    CTX - the crawl context to be used, this holds the mutable state of a crawl and usually depends on the crawl strategy being used
    REQ - the type of request being created by the request handler and used by the crawl client
    RESP - the type of the response being returned by the crawl client and consumed by the response handler
    RES - the type of the result being generated by the response handler

    @NotThreadSafe
public class Crawler<CTX extends CrawlContext,REQ,RESP,RES>
extends Object
    This crawler can be used to crawl datasets. It plays an orchestrating role and ties together a lot of other components that have to be supplied using the constructor.

    This class is not thread-safe as one cannot rely on all the underlying components being thread safe.

    • Method Detail

      • newBiocaseCrawler

        public static Crawler<ScientificNameRangeCrawlContext,String,org.apache.http.HttpResponse,List<Byte>> newBiocaseCrawler(UUID datasetKey,
                                                                                                        int attempt,
                                                                                                        URI url,
                                                                                                        String contentNamespace,
                                                                                                        String datasetTitle)
        Creates a new Crawler for a BioCASe endpoint using default settings. These default settings are:
        • Scientific name ranges will be used for crawling
        • No lock will be used
        • Connection timeouts of 10 minutes will be used
        • 500 connections will be used in total
        Parameters:
        datasetKey - of the dataset to crawl, this is required right now but it can be any random UUID if a non-GBIF dataset should be crawled
        attempt - of this crawl
        url - to crawl
        contentNamespace - a contentNamespace this endpoint supports and that we should use
        datasetTitle - to request

      • newDigirCrawler

        public static Crawler<ScientificNameRangeCrawlContext,String,org.apache.http.HttpResponse,List<Byte>> newDigirCrawler(UUID datasetKey,
                                                                                                      int attempt,
                                                                                                      URI url,
                                                                                                      String resourceCode,
                                                                                                      boolean manis)
        Creates a new Crawler for a DiGIR endpoint using default settings. These default settings are:
        • Scientific name ranges will be used for crawling
        • No lock will be used
        • Connection timeouts of 10 minutes will be used
        • 500 connections will be used in total
        Parameters:
        datasetKey - of the dataset to crawl, this is required right now but it can be any random UUID if a non-GBIF dataset should be crawled
        attempt - of this crawl
        url - to crawl
        resourceCode - of the dataset
        manis - true if this is a MANIS endpoint

        • Scientific name ranges will be used for crawling
        • No lock will be used
        • Connection timeouts of 10 minutes will be used
        • 500 connections will be used in total

        attempt - of this crawl
        url - to crawl
        contentNamespace - a contentNamespace this endpoint supports and that we should use

      • addListener

        public void addListener(CrawlListener<CTX,REQ,RES> listener)
        Adds a listener to this crawler. The listeners will be called in the order they have been added and will run in the same thread as the crawler.
        Parameters:
        listener - to add

      • crawl

        public void crawl()
        This starts a crawl using the provided strategy.

        It will iterate over the contexts the strategy provides. For each context it will also iterate over all the pages. It uses the RequestHandler to build a request for each context which will then be retrieved by the CrawlClient and the response will be handled by the ResponseHandler.
